Aside from his salary, he earns 725 meticais hazard pay for each trip he makes for work. He has been able to save 1000 meticais in his bank account with the help of his wife, who is a nurse.

He has had a loan before from BIM and learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is a customer of this institution. This is Daniel's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction material (cement and electrical materials) to install electricity in his house. The previous loans were for 7,000 and 10,000 meticais and were for his house.

He promises to make his payments on time so he can have more loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement and electrical materials).

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Mr. Tum is 54 years old and the father of four children who are single. One of them is employed in overseas manufacturing. 

Mr. Tum is a local farmer as well as a soldier in Siem Reap province. In order to share responsibility, his wife raises a few ducks and chickens to produce eggs, and then sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. With the rainy season coming now, Mr. Tum will use the loan for which he is asking to rent a machine to plow on his farmland in order to grow fruit crops, and to buy insecticide for protection of his fruit crops.

loans.use: to grow fruit crops and to buy insecticide to protect his fruit crops.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a businessman who does welding.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed three people.  He has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.   He also bought a welding machine with his previous loan.  He hopes to grow his business and register it as a company.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Rondon

texts.en:
Rondon is now 33 years old and married with one infant-aged child. He is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 6,000 per month. 

Rondon is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his vegetable farm. Rondon has been managing his vegetable production for almost six years.

In the future, Rondon hopes to strengthen their sources of income to give their children a better future. He believes that with the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders, he can have a general store to be managed by his spouse.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his vegetable farm

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a business buying and selling used clothing or ukay-ukay products. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Marife is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of used clothing. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothing

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a housewife but she offers her full support to her family at their time of need. She prepares decorative embroidered clothes. She is expert in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 
She also sews clothes and has a good name among her clients due to the good quality of her work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who operates a business selling garments. His shop is located in the market and he sells pants, t-shirts and other garments to his clients at cheap rates. Her husband is 63 years old and sells milk as well as animals. He has some goats at his home, which he used to sell to butchers for a profit. 

Naseem has five sons and a daughter. Her second son also operates a business selling garments and the third one works abroad. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school getting their education. Naseem is hopeful that purchasing garments in larger quantity will enable her son to improve the financial condition of his business. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Jojie Dianne

texts.en:
Jojie Dianne is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 20 years old. Jojie Dianne is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Jojie Dianne owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Jojie Dianne has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture are Jojie Dianne and her daughter.

In 2009, Jojie Dianne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jojie Dianne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jojie Dianne is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jojie Dianne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  To earn a living for his family, he sells household goods such as buckets, basins, plastic chairs and water containers.  He started running the business five years ago.  He also works as a driver to supplement his income.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in a different location.  He needs 35,000 Kes to buy water containers.

loans.use: To buy water containers

loans.name: Analle

texts.en:
Analle Limbas is from the village of P-4 Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Analle runs a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. 

Analle has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. Analle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Analle is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase more products for her general store. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Analle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old and blessed with only one school-aged child.

Marife owns and operates a “sari-sari” (retail) store. She has been engaged in her business for 18 years since she married her husband. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Marife joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Marife is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell and to buy housing materials for her house improvement. This will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy housing materials for house improvement.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Mrs. Thao, 31, earns a living by braiding thatch for roof covering that she sells to her neighbors and other villagers. She learned this skill from her parents when she was single. From her handcraft business, she currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day. She has been married for many years to Mr. Mom, 39, a local farmer, and they have three single children. 

The rainy season is coming now and it is good for her to grow rice crops, but she lacks fund to do it. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Thao is asking for a loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with three school going children, they own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a grocery selling business by selling to her neighbors and passersby. Tatu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry hot season the availability of the food for supply is lower compared to the cold rainy season. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, and onions.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is 53 years old and married with four sons. Her eldest son works in a factory while the others stay at home. Ghulam Fatima couldn’t provide them an education due to financial constraints. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron rods. He sells to different factories and dealers on order. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years. Ghulam Fatima does sewing and embroidery work for her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family. Besides her work, she actively manages her household activities as well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron and make iron rods to fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits. Ghulam Fatima hopes that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and her family will be able to enjoy more financial benefits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. With previous loans, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ghulam Fatima.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Née en 1973, Martine est mariée à Michel un mécanicien Auto. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à charge. Martine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Martine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Martine n’a jamais été à l’école et a appris le métier de couture, un métier qu’elle exerce il y a près de trois ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Martine vend divers produits (lait, sucre, etc.) dans son atelier. Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Martine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  deux premiers crédits dont Martine avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Martine is married to Michel, who is an automobile mechanic. The couple are raising four children, all enrolled in school. Martine lives with her husband and children. She and her husband share in supporting their family. 

Martine never went to school and learned to be a seamstress, a trade she has been working in for nearly three years. At the same time, she sells various products (milk, sugar, etc.) out of her workshop. She buys her merchandise in a market in Bénin. This business brings in money to help support her family. 

With a view to boosting her business and increasing her profit, Martine is requesting her third loan from ALIDé. Her first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions and various items (sugar, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ruth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items, such as powdered milk, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is now 22 years old and married with one infant-aged child. Angie is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Angie is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fingerlings and feeds. Angie operates a fish pond business and has been doing it for almost one year.

In the future, Angie hopes to strengthen this kind of business by raising more fish in order to supplement the income of her husband to satisfy the daily needs of their family and to save funds for their future. She hopes that with the continued support of the Kiva lenders, she believes that someday they can have another kind of business like a grocery store and piggery. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she can achieve her business goals someday.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings and feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ebony wood to manufacture art objects.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en: Emmah is a 50 year-old widowed lady with two children.  She sells chicken and beef to earn a living.  She started her business four years ago and she employs two people.  She says that she has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to own rental houses.   She has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy more chicken and beef.

loans.use: To buy more meat and chicken.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  To earn a living, she sells timber.  Her business is only two years old and she has employed two people.  She also grows crops and rears chicken for extra income.  Previously, she was selling cow-lick salt to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been saving her money.  She wants 20,000 Kes to buy more timber.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man, 41, has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier. She is married to Rais, 48, who works as a goldsmith and he also buys small pieces of gold to make jewelry that he can sell. 

Man will use her loan to buy a used motorbike for picking her fish to sell in the market because her old motor was broken in the process of doing business. She will also use half of her loan as capital for her husband to buy gold.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for transporting fish for sale, and to buy gold for making jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a sari-sari (variety) retail store in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her store.

Ana has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase "pagnes" (traditional cloth) and damask.

loans.name: Darlen

texts.en:
Darlen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc..

Darlen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Darlen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Lory works hard to support her family. She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks. Lory is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy recycled materials to sell in volume for her recycled materials business.

Lory has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell in volume.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelita has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Nelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 56 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy motorcycle spare parts for maintenance.

Shirley has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Turwanyubunebwe Group

texts.fr: Jean Bosco est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Turwanyubunebwe22B, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 6 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il a 42 ans, il a 6 enfants entre 16 et 2 ans, 5 de ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Jean Bosco va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter l’étendu cultivé et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole et veut améliorer la qualité de riz cultivé. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université.
texts.en: Jean Bosco has been a customer of ACB since 2011 and he is a member of the Turwanyubunebwe22B group. He was born in Rwanda and his education comprises six years of primary school. He is 42 years old, has six children between two and 16 years old, and five of his children go to school. This is his first loan and Jean Bosco is going to use it for rice farming, notably for labour costs and the purchase of chemical fertilizer. His plan is to expand the farmable land and to use fertilizers to increase his farming proudtion and he also wants to improve the quality of the rice grown. In the future he wants to be able to finance himself and educate his children up until university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, where she sells to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells scrap metal, which contributes to her other source of income. Josephine faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting charcoal in her business.

With the Kshs 24,000 she wants to purchase 100 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Thelma has a rice vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more rice for resale.

Thelma has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She does mixed farming to earn a living.  She started farming 18 years ago.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has grown her business and improved her living standards.  In the future, she hopes to have a large number of dairy cows in her farm.  She needs 20,000 Kes to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en:
Salomon is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Salomon has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods for her general store.

Salomon has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Salomon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Carmen works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas. Carmen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli, 32, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, buying and selling clothing in the Philippines. Araceli requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional inventory and working capital.

Araceli has been in this business for two years. In the future, Araceli would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Evylen

texts.en:
Evylen is 32 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a general store business in the Philippines. Evylen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Evylen has been in this business for six years. In the future, Evylen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mr. Sor works as a casual laborer in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city. He has been engaged in his job since 2008 and has a formal salary. He has a life partner in his wife who is a used goods vender. She always goes around her community to buy many old things, plastic wires, bottle, can, and copper. She will sell them to her wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two kids. Both of the kids are attending school. Mr. Sor is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more used goods to stock for selling.

loans.use: to buy more used goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Hanel-Len

texts.en:
Ma. Hanel-len works hard to support her family. Ma. Hanel-len is single and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Ma. Hanel-len requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a manicure tool kit.

Ma. Hanel-len has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Hanel-len would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a manicure tool kit

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: Née le 12 octobre 1980 au Bénin, Germaine est mariée à wilis un photographe. Le couple à deux enfants à charge tous scolarisés dont un est leur propre enfant. Germaine n’a jamais été à l’école. Germaine a appris le métier de coiffure, activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis dix ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Germaine vend des produits divers (savons, boîte de conserve, etc.), des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Germaine contribue aux différentes dépenses de la famille. Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et vend ses produits dans son atelier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Germaine sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on October 12, 1980 in Bénin, Germaine is married to Wilis, who is a photographer. The couple is raising two children, both enrolled in school, of whom one is their biological child. 

Germaine never attended school. She learned hairdressing, a trade she has been practicing enthusiastically for ten years. At the same time, she sells general merchandise (soap, canned goods, etc.), hair extensions, and cosmetics. Thanks to the income from her business, Germaine is able to contribute to supporting her family. She buys her merchandise in a market in Bénin and sells her goods out of her beauty shop. With a view to satisfying her clientele and improving her standard of living, Germaine is requesting her fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy five cases of cosmetics, five dozen hair extensions, and two cases of soap.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leopoldo works hard to support his family.

He has a wholesale business selling candies in the Philippines. He earns additional income from raising pigs.  Leopoldo is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for his candies making business.

Leopoldo has been sustaining his business activities through his past eight loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the other two are still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business, where she sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Mlongo faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the availability of charcoal for sale is lower compared to the hot dry season where the availability of charcoal is higher.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sarakhon

texts.ru: Сарахон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, бухгалтер. По специальности проработал 10 лет. Сейчас Сарахон занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 4 года. Кроме того в свободное время он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется мастерская, где он занимается ремонтом автомашин. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sarakhon lives in Hamadoni. He is 42 years old, married, and has six children. He has a vocational education as a bookkeeper. He worked in his profession for ten years. Now, Sarakhon works in animal husbandry.  He fattens and sells cattle. He has been doing this work for four years. In his free time he provides a service.  He has a workshop where he repairs cars. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Для закупа крупнорогатого скота

loans.name: Kandé

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Kandé est mariée à un militaire. Revendeuse de produits de beauté à domicile depuis 1999, elle se déplace certaines fois pour livrer certaines commandes des clientes elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est âgée de 31 ans et aime rendre beau son entourage. Ce prêt lui permettra d’agmenter  le stock de sa marchandise  et satisfaire les demandes
texts.en: A mother of two children, Kandé is married to a soldier. She has been selling beauty products out of her house since 1999, sometimes going from place to place to deliver certain orders for customers. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé. She is 31 years old and likes to make her friends and family look nice. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of merchandise and to satisfy the demand.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Juanalyn

texts.en:
Juanalyn is a 34-year-old married woman with three children ages 12,11 and 5 years old. She has had a food selling business for three years.

Juanalyn sells food like fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. She has been in this business for three years.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase different varieties of fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Juanalyn hopes to have a big business, achieve financial independence and continuously send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Saom, age 59, is a modest villager living in Kampong Chhnang Province with her husband and two children. To earn a living, Saom operates a small handicraft business weaving bamboo baskets for sale. She also sells some vegetables and meals for people who don’t have time to cook.  Saom is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more baskets to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from the village of Unidos, Plaridel. She is 64 years old. Fely is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice to sell. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Fely is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase sacks of fertilizers. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Phard

texts.en: Phard, age 46, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Phard sells vegetables, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her daughter who is a tailor. She earns an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phard has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her children to transport and sell recyclable materials. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport recyclable materials

loans.name: Tubumwemubikorwa Group

texts.fr: Théoneste est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Tubumwemubikorwa, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 6 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il a 49 ans, il a 5 enfants entre 21 et 12 ans, tous ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Théoneste va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter l’étendu cultivé et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole et veut améliorer la qualité de riz cultivé. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Théoneste, 54, has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is a member of the group Tubumwemubikorwa. He was born in Rwanda and he attended primary school for six years. He is married and he has six children between the ages of 36 and 18. Two of his children are attending school. 

This is his first loan, and Théoneste is going to use the loan to grow rice, paying for labor and buying chemical fertilizer. His strategy is to expand the area cultivated and use fertilizer to expand his agricultural production. He wants to improve the quality of rice he grows. In future, he wants to be capable of financing his undertaking himself.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use to grow rice.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is from the village of Highway Lawis, Plaridel. She is 53 years old. Celedonia is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Celedonia owns & operates a business making & selling dining furniture to local businesses and community members. Celedonia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Celedonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celedonia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for her furniture making business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celedonia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling brooms. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwaka dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of brooms for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of brooms for resale.

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en: Making baskets has been a part of 41-year-old Pheun’s daily routine since 1995. Pheun buys raw materials to make baskets and also purchases baskets from other weavers to resell at the market for profit.  Married to a construction worker, she is the mother of six children, five of whom are single. Pheun will be using her loan to pay the arrangement fee for her child to work.

loans.use: to pay the arrangement fee for her child to work.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny, age 58, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Ny is a farmer, earning an income of $3.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since Ny has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Reid

texts.en: Reid sells millet, maize and maize flour. She is 36 years old and married with three children. All of the children go to school. Reid borrowed a loan to stock more millet, maize and maize flour to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to buy more millet, maize and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret, a 30-year-old widowed mother of seven children, all of them attending school, sells clothes. Margret has requested a loan to stock more clothes to sell and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Née en 1971, Victoire est mariée à Joseph un boulanger. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à charge. Victoire vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Victoire assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis sept ans environs, Victoire vend des fruits de façon ambulante. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Sud du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les diverses  charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Victoire sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits dont Victoire avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Born in 1971, Victoire is married to Joseph, a baker. The spouses have four dependent children, all in school. Victoire lives with her husband and children. Victoire and her husband jointly provide for household needs.  For about seven years, Victoire has been selling fruits as a street vendor. She stocks up at a market in the south of Benin. This business activity brings her an income allowing her to cover various family needs. With the view of expanding her business further and increasing her revenues, Victoire is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDe. Her first three loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. One of the major challenges that Mwanaidi faces in her business is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business and increasing her stock in the future.

With her loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, potatoes, and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, potatoes, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar, 47, is a widow and mother of four children, ages 10 to 26. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has two daughters and two sons. Her oldest daughter is a student, her youngest daughter helps with her business, and both of her sons attend a local public school. Chuluunbaatar is a professional tailor. Since 1988, she has been sewing the traditional Mongolian robe, called a “deel.”

Chuluunbaatar supports her family by operating her handmade clothing business. She usually sews deels to sell them at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. In the past 23 years, she has won many regular consumers. She purchases the materials for her clothing from Narantuul. Chuluunbaatar is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase more deel-making materials to sew deels for the Mongolian national “Naadam” celebration, because there is always more demand for deels during this celebration.  

Chuluunbaatar wants to use this loan to improve her business and then build her own small house.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to sew traditional Mongolian robes.

loans.name: Twubakane Group

texts.fr: Jean Pierre est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Twubakane, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 3 ans secondaire, il est marié, il a 3 enfants entre 6 et 1 an, 2 de ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Jean Pierre va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et avoir l’électricité dans sa maison. Jean Pierre est aussi éleveur des petits bétails.
texts.en: Jean Pierre has been a client of ACB since 2011.  He is a member of the Twubakane group.  He was born in Rwanda and has three years of secondary education.  He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 6 years.  Two of his children are in school.  This is his first loan cycle.  Jean Pierre is going to use the loan to pay for labor costs and to buy chemical fertilizers for rice farming.  His strategy is to increase his cultivable land and to use fertilizers to increase his production.  In the future, he wants to be able to self-finance, educate his children up to the university level, and to have electricity in his home.  Jean Pierre also raises small livestock.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his planting

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1955 au Bénin, Elisabeth est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Valentin. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge tous scolarisés. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Elisabeth contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Elisabeth prépare en effet de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce) qu’elle vend depuis près de vingt cinq ans à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Elisabeth vend d'autres produits divers à son domicile. Elisabeth  s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Elisabeth sollicite pour une cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1955, Elisabeth is married to a chauffeur named Valentin. The couple is raising five children, all in school. Thanks to the income generated by her business, Elisabeth contributes to the family's various expenses. She lives with her husband and children.

Elisabeth prepares food (corn paste and rice accompanied by sauce) which she has been selling from her home for more than twenty five years. As a secondary business, she sells various other products from her home. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In order to satisfy her clientele and to improve her standard of living, Elizabeth is seeking a loan through ALIDé for the fifth time.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, and sauce condiments.

loans.name: Poeu

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Poeu, age 21.  She lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. She is a married woman who is devoted to her young child who not yet attending school and depends on her for his care. Her husband works alongside her in their crop planting business. 

Poeu owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother where she grows various crops. Poeu also has another farm that she owns, but she is not yet planting crops on it. She hopes to use this Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and peanut seeds for planting.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, insecticides, and peanut seeds

loans.name: Elmina Silvestre

texts.pt:
Elmina Silvestre nasceu em Maputo Distrito de Marracuene, sul de Mocambique é solteira e mãe de um filho ja empregado. Fez a 6ª classe, teve que interroper devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Marracuene enviando lhes uma sexta básica no valor de 1000.00mt mensalmente.
	
Elmina saiu de Marracuene para Namaacha, alegando que ia estudar, fica grávida e interrompe os estudos.Começa a fazer mukero(venda de produtos cantra bandiada )  na Fronteira da Swazilândia, Com o fundo colectado, consegue construir uma barraca na sua residência onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade, (arroz, açucar feijao, amendoim e mais) tem receita mensal de 4.000.00mt e consegue poupar  1.000.00mt  mensalmente.

 Nunca teve empréstimo em outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves da sua vizinha que e cliente desta instituição.Este é o quarto empréstimo de Elmina na Hluvuku e Kiva para comprar mercadoria aumentando assim a quantidade. Os empréstimos anteriores foram todos de 10.000.00mt para o comércio.

 Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo porque com a mudança da barraca tera mais aceitação. Futuramente pretente adiquirir mais empréstimo e construir uma loja grande.
texts.en:
Elmina Silvestre was born in Maputo in the district of Marracuene in southern Mozambique.  She is single and the mother of one son who is already an adult.  She finished through the sixth grade and did not complete more school because she became pregnant. She lives in her own home and is also responsible financially for her parents, who live in Marracuene.  She sends them 1000 meticals every month.

Elmina left Marracuenefor Namaacha to go to school, but she got pregnant, which interrupted her studies.  She began to sell contraband products on the border with Swaziland.  With the money she mande, she managed to construct a stand in her home where she sells basic goods (rice, sugar, beans, peanuts, and more).  She makes a monthly income of 4,000 meticals and saves 1,000 meticals a month.

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through her neighbor, who is a client of the institution.  This is Elmina’s fourth loan with Hluvuku and Kiva to buy merchandise to increase her inventory.  Her previous loans were all in the amount of 10,000 meticais.

She is confident that she is going to make her payments before they are due.  In the future, she is planning to acquire more loans because if she moves to a larger stand, she will have more business.  In the future, she hopes to acquire another loan to construct a large store.

loans.use: To buy products (rice, beans, peanuts, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Felecidade Naftal

texts.pt:
Felicidade naftal, nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, solteira mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 16 anos. Todos vão a Escola.  Fez a 9ª classe não continuou devido a sua gravidez. Vive numa casa de aluguer com seus filhos responsabiliza se pelas suas 2 madrastas quando pode.


Cresce na companhia das  suas 2 madrastas por te sido abandonada pela sua mãe ainda bebe,nunca saiu do Distrito. Apos a gravides passa a viver com seu marido agora separados. Consegue aranjar um emprego na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como Auxiliar das Limpesas, trabalha das 6h as 14h auferindo mensalmente 2.600.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Consegue poupar na sua conta bancária 200.00mt.

Ja teve empréstimo no BIM, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves da sua colega que também é cliente da instituição. Este é seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( areia, blocos e cimento) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O anterior de 10.000.00mt foi para mesma finalidade.


Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para conclui  as minimas partes da obra e mibiliar a mesma.
texts.en:
Felicidade Naftal was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who are 10 and 16 years old. They both go to school. Felicidade finished 9th grade but did not continue with school because of her pregnancy. She lives in a rented house with her children and takes care of her two stepmothers when she can.

She grew up with her 2 stepmothers because her mother abandoned her when she was a baby. Felicidade has never left the District. After her pregnancy she went to live with her husband; they are now separated. She managed to find a job as a Cleaning Assistant at the Secondary School in Namaacha. She works from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm, earning 2,600 meticais monthly which she uses for household expenses. She has been able to save 200 meticais in her bank account.

Felicidade had a loan from BIM and then learned about Hluvuku through a co-worker who is also a customer of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, blocks and cement) to continue building her house. The first loan of 10,000 meticais was for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of time so she can take out other loans. In the future she intends to take out more loans to finish up construction and furnish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (sand, blocks and cement).

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mrs. May, 44, is a married woman who is blessed with five children.  Four of her children are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Douk.  He is 46 years old and works in the farming business.  

Mrs. May has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living.  As the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for her and her family, Mrs. May has requested a loan of US$ 900 in order to buy feed and more piglets to raise.  She will the rest of the funds to pay for plowing costs and to buy corn seeds for planting.

loans.use: buy more pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Atyrkan

texts.en:
Atyrkan lives in Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 48 and married to a private entrepreneur. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Atyrkan rented a shop and started to sell clothes, bags, and toys. At the moment her monthly profit is 48,000 soms. With money earned from the business, she repaired the house and started building a café. Atyrkan applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase summer clothes. She hopes that the loan will help increase the turnover of her commodities. In the future, the family plans to celebrate their daughter’s wedding.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes.

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling paraffin and charcoal to her neighbours and passers-by. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonality. Mwanaiki dreams of expanding her business and selling as a wholesaler in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase one gallon of paraffin and 50 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one gallon of paraffin and 50 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joao Alberto

texts.pt:
João Alberto nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 56 anos de idade, é casado Pai de 6 filhos de 9 anos aos 26 anos de idade. todos vão a Escola, menos o mais velho pos ja trabalha. para alêm da sua familia responsabiliza se pelo sobrinho orfão de pais, que vive em inhambane enviando em cada seis meses uma sexta basica de 500.00mt

João após concluir o Curso de Professorado é afecto para trabalhar no Distrito de Namaacha onde fixa sua casa depois do casamento. trabalha na Direcçao Distrital da Educaçao, é funcionario permanente, ocupando a função de Tecnico de Produção e Alimemtação Escolar, trabalhando das 7h as 12h no peroido da manhã ouferindo  4.500,00mtn e no periodo da tarde tem feito trabalho no Instituto de Formaçao de Professores e ganha 3.500.00mt.  João vive actulmente com a sua familia numa casa cedida pelos serviços e está a construir a sua própria casa no mesmo Distrito. 
 
Este é o quinto empréstimo de João na Hluvuku e quarto com Kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao (janelas, portas, ligacao de agua e instalacao electrica). Os anteriores de(8.000.00, 9.000,00, 12.500.00 e 15.000.00)mt foi usado para comprar material de construção para dar continuidade da  obra. Este quinto de 10.000.00mt sera usado para fazer manutenção de água e energia. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros creditos no futuro.
texts.en:
João Alberto was born in the province of Inhambane.  He is 56, married, and the father of 6 children who range in age from 9 to 26.  All of them go to school except the oldest, who works.  In addition to his immediate family, he is also responsible for his nephew, who is an orphan and lives in Inhambane.  He sends him 500 meticals every 6 months.

After João finished his couses to become a teacher, he started working in the district of Namaacha where he made his home after he got married.  He works at the District Education Office from 7 am to noon and makes 4,500 meticals a month.  In the afternoon, he works at the teacher training institution and earns 3,500 meticais a month.

João currently lives with his family in a home arranged by a government program and is building a home in the same district.

This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku and his fourth with Kiva in the amount of 10,000 meticals.  He will use it to buy construction materials (windows, doors, plumbing, and electrical installation).  The previous loans were for 8,000, 9,000, 12,500, and 15,000 meticals, which were used to provide water and electricity to his home.  He is confident that he will make his payments in time so he can acquire other loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (windows, doors, plumbing, and electrical installation).

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is a hardworking married man. His wife works as a nurse. He rents a place in the market on Aini Street and sells spare car parts there. He usually buys his goods from the market of Istaravshan City, three times a month. His working capital is about 15,000 TJS. Using the profits from his business, he recently bought a cow. Jamshed would like a loan of 13,000 TJS to purchase a new assortment of spare car parts for his store in order to expand his business and meet the customers’ demands.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy car spare parts.

loans.name: Violeta Lucas

texts.pt:
Violeta Lucas nasceu na Cidade de Inhambane, Provincia do mesmo nome,Sul de Moçambique. tem 48 anos de idade, solteira estudou ate a 12ª classe não ingrenou no ensino superior por falta de condções, não tem filho pois ela é esteril. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e sobrihno. 

Saiu de Inhambane quando teve bolsa para Alemanha antiga RDA, onde fez uma formação proficional de dactilografia. Apois a Independência regressa a Moçambique onde comeca atrabalhar no Distrito de Namaacha na Escola Secundária como dactilógrafa onde trabalha a mais de 20 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h auferindo um valor mensal de 2.960.84mt. vive num quarto no internato da mesma escola então inicia sua obra com o fundo solicitado no BIM no valor de 20.000.00mt, mas não conseguiu concluir devido ao elevado custo do material e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimos para dar continuidade da mesma.


Ja teve emprestimo no BIM, pagou com miuto sucesso, conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia, portas e janelas e outros) para continuar com o melhoramento da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt para habitaéção.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para acedera outros créditos no futuro.
Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Violeta Lucas was born in the city of Inhambane in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is 48 and single.  She finished through the 12th grade and didn’t enroll in higher education because of a lack of financial resources.  She doesn’t have children because she is sterile.  She is responsible financially for her mother and nephew.

She left Inhambane because she had a scholarship in former Western Germany, where she received formal training as a typist.  After the independence, she returned to Mozambique where she began  to work in the district of Namaacha in a high school as a typist where she has worked for more than 20 years from 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  She makes a monthly salary of 2,960.84 meticals.  She lives in a room at the boarding school at the same school.  She started work on her home with funds requested from BIM in the amount of 20,000 meticals.  She wasn’t able to finish it because of the high costs of materials, and she approached Hluvuku and Kiva to request loans to continue it.

She had a loan with BIM, which she paid back successfully.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through colleagues who are clients of the institution.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, windows, etc.) to continue improving her home.  The previous loans were in the amount of 8,000 and 15,000 meticals and were used for her home.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out additional loans in the future.  She hopes to request new loans to finish her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, windows, etc.)

loans.name: Op

texts.en: Op is 27 years old.  She is married but does not yet have any children.  She lives in Kompong Cham Province and currently generates her income by raising piglets in a wooden pen. Her husband is the primary income earner supporting her family.  He works in a garment factory as a garment worker. Op is applying for a loan to purchase additional feed for her pigs and more piglets for breeding, and to repair her old pen.

loans.use: buy pig feed and piglets and repair pig pen

loans.name: Idite Ginoca Jorge

texts.pt:
Idite Ginoca nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, fez a 7ª classe nao concluiu devido a sua gravidez. Vive na casa dos sogros é mãe de 2 filhos de 5 e 12 anos  ambos vão a Escola. Responsabiliza se pelo pai e pelos sogros que vivem com ela na mesma casa.

Após a gravidez passa a viver com seu marido, consegue aranjar um emprego no Hotel Libombos como cozinheira. Trabalha a mais de 11 anos das 7h as 15h no periodo da manhã e das 15h as 22h no periodo da noite auferindo mensalmente 2500.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Consegue poupar mensalmente 1.500.00mt porque conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul e envia lhe mensalmente 5.000.00mt.

Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos para alem da Hluvuku, teve conhecimento atraves dos seus colegas que sao clientes da Instituição. Este e seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com  o qual pretende comprar material de construção( chapas de zinco, cimento, blocos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade da sua obra.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um novo credito para iniciar com a Construção do murro de vedação e sair da casa dos sogros para a sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Idite Ginoca was born in the district of Namaacha.  She is 30-years-old and is married.  She finished through 7th grade and didn’t finish school because she became pregnant.  She lives in her in-laws’ home and is the mother of 2 children, who are 5 and 12.  Both of them go to school.  She is financially responsible for her father and her in-laws.

After she became pregnant, she moved in with her husband and found a job at the Hotel Libombos as a cook.  She has worked there for more than 11 years from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. and from 3 p.m. to 10 p.m.  She makes 2,500 meticals a month, which she puts towards her household’s expenses.  She saves 1,500 meticals a month because she has help from her husband who works in South Africa and sends her 5,000 meticals a months.

She has never worked with other banks besides Hluvuku.  She became familiar with them through her colleagues, who are clients of the institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva in the amount of 15,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand, etc.) to continue working on her home.

She is confident that she will make her payments on time so she can request another loan to begin construction on a boundary wall so she can move from her in-laws’ home to her own home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Twisungane No22 Group

texts.fr: Gratien est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Twisungane no 22, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est primaire, il est marié, il a 5 enfants entre 13 et 9 ans, 4 de ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Gratien va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz, en achetant les insecticides et paiement de main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et avoir l’électricité dans sa maison. Gratien est aussi éleveur des petits bétails.
texts.en: Gratien is a client from ACB since 2011. He is a member of Twisungane #22 group. He was born in Rwanda and has primary education. He is married, with five children from 13 to 9 years of age, four of whom are in school. This is his first loan cycle. Gratien will use his loan for rice farming: buying insecticides and paying for manual labor. His strategy is to increase his cultivated land and to use fertilizers to increase his agricultural production. In the future, he would like to be able to finance his business and provide for his children’s education through university level, and also to have electricity in his house. Gratien also raises  small farm animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a widow with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nadzua has operated a retail shop for the past three years; she sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her products include household consumable products like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves and rice. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Florinda Fabiao

texts.pt:
Florinda Fabiao nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Provincia de Maputo,Sul de Moçambique, solteira estudou ate a 6ª classe não continuou com os estudos porque o seu marido naõ o deixou tem 4 filhos dos quais os 3 mais velhos vaõ a Escola. Vive na casa propria e naõ sustenta mais ninguem para alem de seus filhos. 

Saiu de Manhiça para Maputo com os seus pais quando estes foram transferidos pela empresa onde trabalhavam. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de cobertores ha mais de 10 anos, naõ possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mts por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria

Nunca  teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conhece a Hluvuku atraves de um colega que era cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia, portas e e outros) para continuar com o melhoramento da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt e todos para o negocio.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para acedera outros créditos no futuro.
Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Florinda Fabiao was born in the district of Manhica in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is single and studied through sixth grade.  She didn’t continue with school because her husband didn’t let her.  She has 4 children, and 3 of them go to school.  She lives in her own home and doesn’t support anyone financially besides her children.  She left Manhica for Maputo with her parents when they were transferred by the company for which they worked.  She has had her own business selling blankets for more than 10 years.  She doesn’t have any employees, and she makes a monthly income of 4,000 meticals, which she puts towards her household’s expenses and also saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan with another bank, and she became familiar with Hluvuku through a colleague who was a client of the institution.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, etc.) to continue making improvements to her home.  Her previous loans were in the amounts of 5,000, 10,000, and 20,000 meticals and were used for her business.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can receive more loans in the future.  She plans to request more loans to finish her home and to construct a commercial location for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi has operated a Kikoi's sales business for the past two years. She sells her wares from home to her neighbours and passers-by. The primary business challenge she faces is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Nazi and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. The family owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase bundles of leso’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of leso’s to offer for sale

loans.name: La Droiture Group

texts.fr:
Mme Bilguissa est la responsable du groupe la DROITURE .Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Son enfant à 3ans. L’enfant ne va pas a l’école et elle n’a personne a sa charge.

Madame vend du bois de chauffe depuis 2ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnant. Ses clients son ses voisins du quartier.

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter du un camion de bois de chauffe.

Mme veut utilisé ses bénéfices pour augmenter son activité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande vendeuse de bois de chauffe (approvisionner les petits vendeurs).Elle veut prendre soin de son enfant, l’amener à l’école afin de lui promettre un avenir meilleur et aider son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en: Mrs. Bilguissa is the leader of the DROITURE group.  She is married and the mother of one child, who is three years old.  The child does not go to school and she is not responsible for any others. She has been selling firewood for 2 years.  She gets her supplies in the surrounding villages.  Her clients are her neighbors in the district. She wants to buy a truck for the firewood with the loan awarded.  Bilguissa wants to use her profits to expand her business.  Her goal is to become a firewood wholesaler (to supply the small sellers).  She wants to take care of her child, to send him to school so as to ensure a better future for him. and to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy a truck for firewood

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a married woman with five children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Sakina has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to start a charcoal business and purchase 30 sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with five children. Four of her attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and clothes for the family.

For the past 5 years, she has operated a vegetable stall selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a goat selling business which contributes to her income. Sofia faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables and goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables and goats for resale

loans.name: Terimberemuhinzi No45 Group

texts.fr: Clément est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Terimberemuhinzi, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est primaire, il est marié, il a 3 enfants entre 12 et 7 ans, tous ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Clément va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz, en achetant les insecticides et paiement de main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et avoir l’électricité dans sa maison. Clément est cultivateur des mais aussi.
texts.en: Clément has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is a member of  the  Terimberemuhinzi  group. He was born in Rwanda and has primary education. He is married, with three children from 12 to 7 years of age, all of whom are in school. This is his first loan cycle. Gratien will use his loan for rice farming: buying insecticides and paying for manual labor. His strategy is to enlarge his cultivated land and to use fertilizers to increase his agricultural production. In the future, he would like to be able to finance his business himself and provide for his children’s education through university level, and also to have electricity in his house. Clément also grows corn.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
For the past three years, Guljahon has worked in agriculture, raising animals. She raises cattle which she cares for with enjoyment since, thanks to them, she can cover her household expenses. She feeds her cattle for two or three weeks and then sells them in the market. Guljahon also has land in the size of 1.5 hectares for growing different vegetables. 

For Guljahon, it is very important to work raising her animals which is why she is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that she can earn more money in future. This will help her family to generate additional income. Guljahon appreciates your support for her project.      
 	
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a fifty-two-year-old married woman with seven children, living on her own in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her husband is a mason and their dream is to educate their children up to university level. 

She has two motorcycles for her transport business and also operates a retail shop. Her major challenge is the riders who do not remit money on time, and her dream is to own at least five motorcycles so as to spread the risk. Margret needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
