loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of sugar and jerrycans of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Moonlight

texts.en: Moonlight is a married woman who hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female, aged 43 years, who has owned a retail shop for fifteen years. A mother of four children, she dreams of educating her children to university level and setting up other income generating activities from which she can earn extra income. She acquired her initial capital from her husband. Moonlight needs a loan to purchase mattresses, beers, and sodas for resale.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses, beers, and soda for resale.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a hardworking woman and the mother of three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. After the Soviet collapse Gulnora lost her job. She had worked as a telephone operator. 

She started her clothing business three years ago, and today she successfully continues this business.  Her children study at school and she wants them to get a good education in order to enroll in the university. She tries to provide all her children’s needs for their education. From her profits she plans to purchase schoolbooks and a computer in order to better their knowledge. 

Gulnora would like to get a loan of 4,500 TJS for purchasing new clothes for resale.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new assortments of clothes.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet wants a loan to buy hair cutting tools, a sterilizer machine and cosmetics for her salon that she has run for three years. Aged 30 years, Violet hails from the Kyenjojo District in Uganda. She is the mother of three children, with whom she lives together with their father, in a rented three-room house. Having gotten money from her husband, she started her salon that has grown over the years. Her dream is to build a residential house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy hair cutting tools, a sterilizer machine and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of brooms for resale.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a Ugandan male, aged 38 years, who needs a loan to prepare land for planting next season. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, and is the father of eight children between the ages of 11 and 2. He dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house to replace the semi-permanent house that he now owns. A farmer for ten years, he acquired his start up capital from selling Irish potatoes, which is now his major business.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting next season.

loans.name: Twongerumusaruro Group

texts.fr: Zachée est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Twongerumusaruro, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est primaire, il est marié, il a 7 enfants entre 23 et 8 ans et tous ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Zachée va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz, en achetant une petite machine agricole. Ses stratégies sont d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et leur accompagner jusqu’à leur indépendance. Zachée est cultivateur des mais aussi.
texts.en: Zachée has been a client of ACB since 2011.  He is a member of the Twongerumusaruro group.  Zachée was born in Rwanda and has an elementary school education.  He is married with 7 children between the ages of 8 and 23; all the children go to school.  This is his first group loan.  Zachée is going to use the loan to buy a small agricultural machine for cultivating rice.  His strategies are to increase his cultivable land and to use fertilizers to increase production.  In the future, he wants to be able to self-finance and to educate his children up to the University level and to support them until they are independent.  Zachée also grows corn.

loans.use: To buy a small farming machine

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a Ugandan male, aged 44 years, who needs a loan to pay laborers for weeding his maize plantation. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, and is the father of three children, aged 14, 12 and 5. He dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house to replace the semi-permanent house that he now owns. A farmer for ten years, he acquired his start up capital from accumulated savings from his salary at a local tea factory.

loans.use: to pay laborers for weeding his maize plantation.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a Ugandan male aged 26 years who owns a boutique. He dreams of educating his children and setting up other income generating activities from which he can earn extra income. He acquired his initial capital from brewing alcohol. John wants a loan to purchase women and men's wear to sell in his boutique.

loans.use: To purchase women and men's wear for his boutique

loans.name: Mahugnon As Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON AS est un  groupement composé de vingt personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Annick est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick est née le 19 Mai 1972 au Bénin. Annick est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec elle. Annick ne vit plus avec son mari. Annick supporte seule les charges de ses enfants. Pour y arriver, Annick prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagné de poissons frits) qu'elle vend à sa clientèle. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Annick mène cette activité depuis quinze ans et s'approvisionne au Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Annick et à son groupe de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mahugnon As is a group composed of twenty people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time that the group has sought a loan through ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business and better respond to their clients' demand. 

The group's representative Annick is the one raising her hand in the photo. Annick was born May 19, 1972 in Benin. She is the mother of two children, both in school and living together with her. She is no longer living with her husband; she alone pays her children's expenses. In order to make a living, Annick prepares food (corn paste accompanied by fried fish) which she sells to her clientele. This business generates income for her, helping her meet her children's needs. Annick has been running this business for fifteen years and gets her supplies in Benin.

This loan will surely allow Annick and her group to improve their businesses and increase their sales and their income.

loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, and fresh fish.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a Ugandan male aged 36 years who needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell. He has operated this business for six years. He hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a father of five children who lives in an incomplete permanent house with six people that he takes care of. He dreams of educating his children to a self-reliant level. He acquired his initial capital from growing bananas. He faces the problem of agricultural price fluctuations and his dream is to own a food store.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a maize mill.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman who hails from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 46 years who buys and sells local brew. A mother of four children, she dreams of educating her children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a sugar cane plantation. Grace wants a loan to purchase alcohol to sell.

loans.use: To purchase alcohol to sell

loans.name: Tuve Mutulo Group

texts.en: Philipo wants a loan to buy coffee to sell. He is a member of Tuve Mutulo, a group which means "we should get out of sleep". The members guarantee each other to access a loan. He is 43 years old and a father to 10 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in agricultural produce sellin. This is a business he has done for 14 years. He started out by selling second clothes from which he saved money to start up the produce business. His goal is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widow with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a business selling cashew nuts, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season, the supply of fish is minimal and doesn't satisfy her customer's needs. She dreams of establishing business blocks to rent in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy household items like a television and a generator

loans.name: Fridaus

texts.en:
Fridaus is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut vending business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry, hot season, the availability of coconuts is minimal. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan of KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase coconuts and brooms for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts and brooms to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 23 года. Не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Ее отец занимается растениеводством, а мама у нее домохозяйка. Сама Фируза имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она преподает в средней школе. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Firuza lives in Hamadoni. She is 23 years old and single.  She lives with her parents. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a housewife.  Firuza has a higher education in pedagogy. She teaches high school. Additionally, in her free time she works in animal husbandry.  She raises cattle for sale.  She has been doing this work for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jenny de 45 años,  vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es soltera y tiene ya sus hijos mayores de edad. Es comerciante y productora de mariscos.

Empezó su negocio cuando compro un pequeño motor fuera de borda y lo puso a pescar para producir camarones y pescados junto con su sobrino para luego comenzar a comercializar estos productos que son muy apetecidos en los restaurantes y hoteles de las costas. Labora de 8H00 am a 11H00 am va a entregar los pedidos a los dueños de restaurantes y hoteles que le hacen y en la tarde se encarga con su hijo y sobrino a ver en la playa mas marisco para las venta en la plazoleta de playas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas productos de mariscos como langostinos, camarones, calamares, para aumentar sus ingresos. La meta de ella es comprarse una embarcación mas grande para abastecerse de mercadería y comercializar también desea que su hijo termine la universidad.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 45, lives in the canton of Playas, a tourist area in Ecuador which has many types of seafood.  She is single and has two adult children.  She sells and produces seafood.

She began her business when she bought a small outboard motor boat which she used to fish for shrimp and varieties along with her nephew.  She began sellling these products to restaurants and hotels along the coast.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m., then delivers orders to the owners of the restaurants and hotels, and in the afternoons sells more seafood at the beach with her son and nephew.  She plans to use the loan to buy more seafood such as prawns, shrimp and squid in order to increase income.  Her goal is to buy a larger boat to have more merchandise to sell.  She wants her son to finish his college education.

loans.use: To buy seafood such as prawns, shrimp and squid.

loans.name: Efrain Enrique

texts.es: Efrain es un  hombre de 57 años que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 27 años y vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, cuadros al óleo, fritangueria y venta almuerzos. Él  inició su experiencia de negocio hace 7 años  con una tienda, pero otorgó muchos créditos irrecuperables y debió cambiar de actividad para lograr alternativas más rentables y menos riesgosas; fue así que con el apoyo de sus dos hijos menores, empezaron a vender productos mediante guías especializadas a la que  luego agregaron sandalias, bisutería y elaboración de cuadros al óleo;  Efrain siempre buscando oportunidades de ingresos donde obtuviera dinero diario,  comenzó a vender fritos  diariamente y los fines de semana almuerzos, porque su meta es progresar en su negocio poco a poco y lograr habilitar un local, para surtirlo con toda la mercancía que él vende, pues su mayor desafío es ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará 5 docenas de sandalias, 7 oleos,  artesanías, cerámica, bisutería relojes y materia prima en mayor volumen para elaborar fritos y los almuerzos que vende con una freecuencia semanal, en la actualidad  su clientela se ha incrementado  día a día y mientras cumple con su sueño, continua esforzándose en la generación de ingresos familiares mediante sus negocios a través del cual obtiene una rentabilidad no menor del 51%.
texts.en:
Efrain is a 57-year-old man who has three children between the ages of 15 and 27. He lives in the city of Malambo where he works selling a variety of merchandise such as oil paintings, fried snack foods and prepared lunches. He began his business experience seven years ago with a shop, but he extended credit that in many cases was unrecoverable, and had to change the business so he could achieve alternatives which were more profitable and less risky. Thus, with the support of his two younger children, they began to sell products through specialized guides to which they later added sandals, costume jewelry and the making of oil paintings.  Efrain is always looking for income opportunities to bring in money every day. He began selling fried snacks on a daily basis and lunches on the weekends. 

His goal is to progress in his business little by little, and be able to set up a shop, and stock it with all the merchandise he sells. His greatest challenge is to be able to offer a quality education to his children. This Kiva credit is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will purchase five dozen pairs of sandals, seven oil paintings, handicrafts, ceramics, costume jewelery and a large volume of basic ingredients for making fried foods and the lunches he sells weekly. Currently his customer base is growing day by day, and, as he makes his dream come true, he continues on diligently to bring in a family income by means of his business, in which he achieves a profitability of no less than 51%.

loans.use: to buy five dozen pairs of sandals, seven oil paintings, handicrafts, ceramics, costume jewelry, clocks and a large volume of basic ingredients for making fried foods.

loans.name: Anthony A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the Khulafai Rashideen Primary School in Mile Ninety-One, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. Khulafai Rashideen Primary School was founded in 1999 by the Islamic Jamat (Community). The school is staffed with nine able teachers.  

Anthony is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 65-year-old Anthony was born in Mile Ninety One town. He has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. He is married and has six children. Anthony has requested this loan to buy house building materials to complete his house building project.

Staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshots of Ansu, a borrowers who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy house building materials to complete his house building project

loans.name: Jovial Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata  est la représentante du groupe JOVIAL. Elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé à 18ans  et le moins âgé à 9 mois.3de ses enfants vont à l’école et elle prend 3 personnes a sa charge.
 
Mme  vend de la patte d’arachide et du zoom koom (jus de petit mille) depuis 3 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à goursi un village du Burkina faso.ses clients sont ses voisins du quartier.

Elle veut  s'acheter 9 sacs d’arachides et un sac de petit mil.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’occuper de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un machine à décortiquer et à écraser pour  ses arachides et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants  afin de leur assurer un avenir radié.
texts.en:
Madame Fatimata is the representative of the Jovial group. She is married and the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 18 and the youngest, nine months. Three of her children go to school, and she also supports three other people.

Madame Fatimata has been selling peanut butter and "zoom koom" (a drink made from millet and ginger) for three years. She gets her supplies in Goursi, a village in Burkina Faso, and her clients are her neighbors. She would like to buy nine bags of peanuts and one bag of millet.

With her profits, she would like to take care of her children. Her goals are to buy a machine to shell and grind the peanuts and to pay for her children's schooling, in order to make sure they have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy nine bags of peanuts and one bag of millet

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three months, she has operated a natural juice making business. She sells at home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells palm leaves for roof thatching, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasha faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting palm leaves from the rural area to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase an ice cooler box and start another business selling cloth material. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase an ice cooler and start another business selling cloth material

loans.name: Dizzaya

texts.en:
Dizzaya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children.  Dizzaya has a business of a library shop, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Dizzaya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase video CDs and movies for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Dizzaya hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Dizzaya hopes to expand her business.  Dizzaya is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase video CDs and movies for resale.

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en:
Katiba is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school and one graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a café business, cooking chapatti (flat bread, beans and rice). Katiba also makes natural fruit juice for sale, which contributes to her other source of income. Her potential customers are local villagers and students attending a nearby school. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, the number of customers attending her business is low.  She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 100 Kilograms of rice, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 Kilograms of rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sauya

texts.en:
Sauya is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Sauya has a business of selling hand bags for ladys, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Sauya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more hand bags for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sauya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Sauya hopes to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hand bags for resale

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling palm leaves. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwatime faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry, hot season, the availability of palm leaves for supply is lower and does not satisfy her customer's demands. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of palm leaves in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of palm leaves for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of palm leaves to sell

loans.name: Basoka Kwavula Group

texts.en: Base is a businesswoman who hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 30 years who owns a boutique. She dreams of educating her five children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a restaurant she owned. Base is a member of the above-named group where each member guarantees the others in accessing credit .Base wants a loan to buy children’s wear for resale in her boutique.

loans.use: To buy children’s wear to sell.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Ritah has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay for school for herself. In the future, Ritah hopes to complete her studies. Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Tunu has operated a business selling mahamri (dumplings) for the past 10 years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase one sack of sugar and a bundle of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of sugar and a bundle of wheat flour.

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Glenny is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 1, 2 & 3 (Going Forward). She makes her home in a simple structure with her parents. She operates a business where she sells underwear, both in her house and by walking. She is a young hardworking woman just 26 years old, whose challenges are to do business, get a good income and to start studying in the university.

Glenny is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost one year, which she started with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing  a big quantity of underwear at wholesale prices. 

Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The main economic activities are a free trade zone and a cement factory. Their community is a tourist area outside San Pedro and Santo Domingo, which makes this community very active. There are a lot of businesses and people working in the street. Also, this town is close to the main airport of the Dominican Republic.

loans.use: to buy underwear at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Milly has a business of tailoring, which she has had for eight years.         

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Milly hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Milly hopes to buy a plot of land.  Milly is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Fatuma has operated a palm leaf selling business for the past 10 years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult for the customers to access her business. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying as a wholesaler in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of palm leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky sells sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Vicky took out a loan to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan sells beans and sugar. She is 28 years old, married with 2 children, and both of them go to school. Susan took out a loan to stock more beans and sugar to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana  vive en la bella ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad  que es su máximo impuso para el arduo trabajo diario, con tal de lograr su bienestar y ofrecerle mejores posibilidades de éxito futuro. Ella tiene un negocio donde vende ropa y accesorios, que inició hace un año cuando no encontraba empleo y debió prepararse,  generar ingresos y sostener  a su bebé. Con la ayuda de sus familiares, ella emprendió  un pequeño almacén donde hoy vende todo tipo de  ropa, inicialmente comenzó la línea femenina, gradualmente   adicionó la línea masculina y aprovechó su punto de venta para ofrecer las mercancías más  solicitadas por su clientela y con ello ha ganado mucha aceptación en su sector. El Credikiva es es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  vestidos femeninos, masculinos e infantil, preparándose para las próximas celebración del día del padre, pues le han hecho pedidos  en el marco de esta fecha, porque las familias quieren verse elegante al compartir en este día. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio logrando todos los días nuevos clientes, para aumentar sus ingresos y sacar a su hijo adelante.
texts.en:
Diana lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias with her 1 year-old son who is the main reason for all her hard work.  She works hard to provide for him and so that she can offer him better possibilities for future success.  Diana has a business where she sells clothes and accessories.  She started her business a year ago when she wasn't able to find work.  She had to make income and support her baby.

With the support of her family members, Diana set up a small store where she sells all kinds of clothes.  She started out selling women's clothes but gradually started selling men's clothes too.  She made the most of her sales location, offering merchandise which was most in demand with her customers.  She has gained a lot of customers in her area.

This Kiva loan is Diana's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy women's, men's and children's clothes, in preparation for Father's Day as customers have made orders with her for this date because families want to dress up in order to share the day together.

Diana's dream is to expand her business and continue to attract new customers so that she can increase her income and get her son ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Amparo; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cubrecamas, sabanas y cortinas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia también trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba en el área de almacen,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cortinas, sabanas y cubrecamas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de variedad de sabanas, cubrecamas y sabanas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba". It is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Nancy Amparo. She is 43 years old, single, and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling comforters, bed sheets, and curtains. She makes her sales itinerantly in the market in Urubamba. She also works in the municipality of Urubamba, in the warehousing sector. She wants to expand and improve her business selling curtains, bed sheets, and bedspreads. She requires a loan to purchase merchandise including a variety of bed sheets, bedspreads and linen.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bed sheets, bed spreads, and linen.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para vender en la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Carmen is 38 years old, single, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Carmen sells essential household products such as rice, sugar, noodles, cookies, etc.  She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Carmen would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products wholesale to sell in her store.

Carmen is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Fredesvinda is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 4, 5 & 6 (Going Forward). This group is composed of 15 entrepreneurs, dedicated to selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food and many other businesses. Their community is a tourist area outsiD. San Pedro and Santo Domingo. That makes this community very active, a lot of business going on and people working in the street; also this town is close to the main airport of the Dominican Republic. 

Fredesvinda makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. They are living together and they are looking to progress together by working and bringing income to the home.

Fredesvinda operates a business where she sells clothing. She is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for six years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying other products like shoes, underwear and more clothes. She will save part of her profits and invest the rest in her business. Through this business she wants to make her dreams come true, especially to have her own house. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her family life by starting doing business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy other products like shoes and underwear and also more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende fideos, arroz, azúcar, harinas, aceite y golosinas, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maruja is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil and candies.  She works from 5.00am to 10.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Maruja would like to expand and improve her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.

Maruja is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Francisca; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella es propietaria de un restaurant donde prepara diferentes platos de comida en las diferentes festividades que se realiza en el distrito de Urubamba como es la fiesta del Sr de Torrechayoc que es una fiesta tradicional en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia también vende cerveza y ponches, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Juana Francisca is 43 years old, single, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She is the owner of a restaurant where she prepares a number of different dishes.  During the different festivities that take place in Urubamba district such as the 'Sr de Torrechayoc' fiesta (a traditional fiesta in this district) she also sells beer and punch.  Through her business, Juana gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her restaurant service.  She is requesting this loan to buy food products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

Juana Francisca is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Mpiriggwa Twezimbe Group

texts.en: Most successful businesses in Uganda are built out of unwavering diligence, persistence and a sheer determination to succeed. Many people see running a business as a means to an end in their quest to extricate themselves out of poverty.  34-year-old enterprising  Sarah is one such person. This happily married mother of 4 has been plying her charcoal sales business in Mityana for the past 2 years. She ekes out further profits from selling bananas. She also has a farm.  Before she ventured into this business she was engaged in a tailoring business.  She says her weekly sales profits are 30,000 shillings.  With this loan, Sarah says she is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea forma parte del Banco comunal “El Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a la orfebrería, trabajo artístico realizado sobre utensilios o adornos de metales preciosos, o aleaciones de ellos, mezcla sólida homogénea de metales. Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 25 años, ya que su padre ha practicado éste oficio toda su vida, por lo que también ha sido heredado, además su padre cuenta con su propio taller y joyería. Po lo que Andrea aprovecha de fabricar su artesanía en éste taller, para lo cual debe comprar el gas y oxigeno para fundir los metales.
A Andrea le va muy bien en éste negocio, tiene  bastante clientela frecuente, entre estos se encuentran trabajadores de los hospitales y consultorios. 
Con el crédito comprará metales como oro y plata, además de pagar el gas y oxigeno que utiliza en el taller de su padre. 
Sus metas son tener su propio taller y joyería, para fabricar y vender sus productos. Además anhela comprarse una camioneta para el traslado de mercadería y maquinarias. Junto con esto pretende incursionar en otro rubro que también le permita generar otros ingresos, éste rubro sería el de producción y venta de comida para los almuerzos de algunos obreros de la construcción, lugar donde trabaja su marido.
Andrea vive junto a su madre, su marido y sus tres hijos de 18 años, 9 años y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, que ésta sea más confortable. Además pretende dejar su negocio como herencia a sus hijos. 
Andrea está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha servido para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con las demás socias, existe mucho respeto en el grupo.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Andrea is part of the communal bank "El Progreso" and lives in the communal area of Independencia in the city of Santiago. She works in artistic metalworking, creating utensils and adornments out of precious metals and alloys - a solid mix of several metals. She has worked in this area for 25 years, inheriting the skill from father who has been practicing the craft all his life. Her father has his own workshop and jewelery store. Andrea takes advantage of this workshop to create her  handcrafted articles, so she must pay for the gas and oxygen used to work the metals.

This business is going very well for Andrea. She has quite a few frequent clients, including workers from the hospitals and medical centers. With this loan she will buy metals like gold and silver and pay for the gas and oxygen she uses in her father's workshop.

Her goals are to have her own workshop and jewelery store to make and sell her products. Also she hopes to buy a van to move her merchandise and machinery. Along with this she also plans to begin work in another area that will allow her to generate more income. This will be the production and sale of meals for the lunches of some of the construction workers from her husband's workplace.

Andrea lives with her mother and her husband and their three children - 18, 9, and 3 years old. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her children so they can be more comfortable. She also hopes to leave her business as an inheritance for her children.

Andrea is pleased and grateful for the credit provided by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. Regarding the meetings with the other members, there is a great deal of respect in the group.

Independencia is one of the 34 municipalities that make up the city of Santiago (capitol of Chile), located in the center-north sector. It grew around the end of the 19th century as a traditional area of the city. Its main axis is Independence Avenue, the old route of the ancient Road of the Inca and the northern entrance to the city of Santiago. Given its abundant indigenous population the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile is located here. Independencia also boasts of important historic constructions, including six historic monuments of Chile.

loans.use: buy metals like gold and silver and pay for the gas and oxygen she uses in her father's workshop.

loans.name: Elmer Edgar

texts.es:
Elmer es un cliente de  30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa e hijo en la zona rural del distrito de Jayanca – Lambayeque. Las actividades principales de esta comunidad son la agricultura y ganadería.

Elmer se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 5 años, él cuenta con terreno agrícola donde cosecha maíz que luego comercializa a clientela ya establecida, quienes son principalmente pobladores de su zona.
 
Elmer es un hombre muy trabajador pues sabe que su esfuerzo beneficia a su familia. Él tiene muchos deseos de darle lo mejor a su hijo y de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Elmer solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en mejorar su cultivo de maíz, comprando los abonos y fertilizantes adecuados y también para el deshierbo de este. Esto le permitirá obtener ganancias (producto de su cosecha)  e ir creciendo económicamente. 

Elmer estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito, pues le ayudaría a aumentar sus ganancias para darle mayores comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in the rural area of Jayanca district, Lambayeque.  The main business activities in this community are farming and livestock raising.

Elmer has been farming for more than five years.  He has a plot of farmland where he grows corn which he then sells to established customers who are mainly residents of his area.

Elmer is a very hard-working man as he knows that his efforts benefit his family.  He has a great desire to provide his son with the very best and to improve his quality of life.

Elmer is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will invest this money in improving his corn crop, buying appropriate manures and fertilizers and weeding his land.  This will enable him to make profits (from his harvest) and continue growing financially.  Elmer is very grateful for this loan as it will help him to increase his profits which will enable him to provide his family with more comforts.

loans.use: to buy manures and fertilizers for his crops and to weed his land

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE D. URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida, ella prepara distintos platos como anticuchos que es un plato a base D. carne con papas hechas en parrilla, también venD. caldo D. gallinas y asado D. carne, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria en el distrito D. Yucay,la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, papa, gallina, carne y leña.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the "San José D. Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Dominga is 53 years old, married, and has seven children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She prepares different dishes such as 'anticuchos' (a grilled meat and potato dish).  She also sells chicken soup and barbecued meats.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in Yucay district.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Dominga would like to expand and improve her food business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy products to cook such as rice, potatoes, chicken and meat.  She will also buy firewood.

Dominga is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food products to cook such as rice, potatoes, chicken, meat, and also firewood

loans.name: America

texts.es:
America es una mujer de 62 años de edad que vive en la zona rural del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz – Chiclayo. America siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y luchadora por el bienestar de sus hijos, quienes ahora son personas integras e  independientes.

La actividad que desarrolla America es la venta de comidas en el interior de un mercado del distrito de Chiclayo. America tiene gran experiencia en su negocio pues hace 20 años lo viene realizando. Ella se inicio como ayudante de cocina y su esfuerzo y dedicación le permitió tener su propio puesto de comida.  Los clientes de America están muy satisfechos con el servicio que ella brinda.

America tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y por eso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles para mejorar su vivienda, exactamente para la reparación de sus servicios higiénicos y cocina que se encuentran en estado crítico. Ella desea arduamente esto y estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad.

America es un cliente reactivado de nuestra institución y solo ha trabajado con nosotros.
texts.en:
America is a 62 year-old woman who lives in the rural area of José Leonardo Ortiz district, Chiclayo.  America has always been a hard-working woman who has worked hard for the good of her children.  Her children are now grown up and live independently.

America's business activity is selling food in a market in Chiclayo district.  She has a lot of experience in her business, which she has been working in for 20 years.  She started out as an assistant cook and, through her efforts and commitment, she was able to acquire her own food stall.  America's customers are very satisfied with the service that she provides.

America has a great desire to improve her quality of life and, for this reason, she has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to improve her home.  She will repair her bathroom and kitchen facilities which are in a critical condition.  She would really like to be able to carry out this work and would be very grateful for the loan as it would help her a lot.

America is a return client of our institution and has only worked with us.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom and kitchen facilities in her home

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Leonardo; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados y venta de pasteles, el distribuye los helados y pasteles a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes del distrito de Urubamba y también lleva a lugares como Maras, Izcuchaca y Chinchero, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasteles y helados.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azúcar y fruta para preparar los helados y pasteles.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonardo belongs to the San Jose de Urubamba Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Leonardo is 54 years old, married, and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business of selling ice cream and cake.  He distributes the ice creams and cakes to different grocery stores in the Urubamba district.  He also takes them to places like Maras, Izcuchaca, and Chinchero.  He works in an independent manner.  

He wants to expand and improve his business of selling ice cream and cake.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, and fruit to make the ice creams and cakes.

He is very happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, and fruit to make ice creams and cakes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 48 años de edad ella vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. 

Gloria cuenta con un pequeño restaurante de comida marina ubicado en su propio domicilio. Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 7 años y cuenta con gran demanda y con clientes ya establecidos en la zona. Su negocio esta adecuadamente condicionado y lo abre los fines de semana y los lunes, el resto de la semana Gloria se dedica a ayudar a su esposo con sus labores y a cuidar a sus hijos.

El esposo de Gloria también colabora con su negocio, cuando no esta realizando sus labores agrícolas. Él cuenta con cultivos de limón y mango que actualmente se encuentran en producción.

Gloria ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra de cerveza para su restaurante, pues sus clientes siempre acompañan sus platos picantes con esta bebida que tan bien le combina.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 48, lives with her two children and her husband in a small rural community in the Tambogrande – Piura district.

Gloria has a small seafood restaurant located in her home.  She has had this business for seven years.  There is a great demand for her food, and she has established customers in the area.  Her business is suitably equipped, and it is open on the week-ends and on Mondays.  

The rest of the week Gloria helps her husband with his work and takes care of her children.  Gloria’s husband also collaborates with her in her business when he is not doing his farm work.  He has lemon and mango crops that are now producing.

Gloria has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy beer for her restaurant.  Her customers always accompany her spicy dishes with this drink, which goes so well with them.

loans.use: to buy beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad rural del distrito de San Pedro ubicado en Pacasmayo -  La Libertad. A pesar de vivir en una zona rural la calidad de vida de esta familia es buena.

Rosa cuenta, desde hace 3 años, con una bodega en su domicilio, en esta vende todo tipo de abarrotes (fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, etc.), algunas frutas y verduras, bebidas y golosinas. A pesar de tener una tienda pequeña, esta está bien surtida y cuenta con clientes fijos.

Rosa desea invertir en su negocio para que este le produzca mayores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que repartirá en el mejoramiento de su cocina y en comprar nuevos productos para su bodega.

Rosa tiene muchos deseos de arreglar su cocina y de que su negocio crezca para poder hacer arreglos en su hogar, por su propia cuenta. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 44 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and children in a rural community in the district of San Pedro located in Pacasmayo - La Libertad.  Despite living in a rural area, they have a good quality of life.   

For the past 3 years Rosa has been running a store out of her house where she sells all types of grocery products (noodles, rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc.), some fruits and vegetables, drinks and sweets.  Even though her store is small it is well-stocked and she has a steady clientele.  

Rosa would like to invest in her business so that she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to make improvements to her kitchen and buy new products for her store. 

Rosa is eager to make improvements to her kitchen.  She wants her business to grow so that she is able to make other improvements in her home.  This loan will be very useful.

loans.use: make improvements to her kitchen and stock her store.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Irene Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene Emilia; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasto (se usa para alimento de cuyes y ganados),ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles del distrito Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasto. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasto al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Irene Emilia is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She makes a living selling animal feed (used to feed guinea pigs and livestock).  She makes her sales as a street vendor on the different streets in the Urubamba district.  She works from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm.  This business helps her to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her feed sales.  She is requesting a loan to buy feed wholesale.  

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase wholesale animal feed.

loans.name: Agatinde Group

texts.fr: Simon  est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Agatinde, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 8 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il est cultivateur de riz, il a 30 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 12 et 1 an, 2 de ses enfants va  à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Simon va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est suivre les étapes appropriées et selon la saison pour augmenter la production. Dans l’avenir, il veut un augmenter la surface à cultiver.
texts.en: Simon has been an ACB customer since 2011 and is a member of the Agatinde group. He was born in Rwanda and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 30 years old and has three children between one and twelve years old, two of whom attend school. He is a rice grower by trade. This is the first loan that he has sought and he will use it to pay labour costs and to purchase chemical fertiliser. His plan is to follow the necessary steps and to harvest his crops during the correct seasons so that he can boost production further. In future he would like to extend the area of land that he cultivates.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers and pay labour costs

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Sixto; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, el hace trabajos como mesas, sillas y puertas, el trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y luego lo vende en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de carpintería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera, pegamento y pintura para hacer las mesas, sillas y puertas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señor Sixto is a member of the communal bank "Perolniyoc" located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Señor Sixto is 38 years old, lives with his partner and has one child.  He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business.  He makes things like tables, chairs and doors.  He works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and then he sells his products independently.  He wants to expand and improve his carpentry business.  He is requesting a loan to buy wood, glue and paint to make tables, chairs and doors.  

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: buy wood, glue and paint to make tables, chairs and doors for his carpentry business.

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz en el municipio de Tezonapa Existe una comunidad llamada el cedro en el cual existe una UDE (grupo de mas de diez personas que tienen una cuenta en el banco y tienen que reunirse semanal o quincenalmente para hacer sus pagos)la cual lleva el mismo nombre en honor a la comunidad que habitan, este grupo esta formado por  11  integrantes

El representante del grupo se llama Emilia tiene la edad de 52 años, estudio solo la primaria, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno hombre de nombres Graciela de 24 años, Vicente de 28 años y Vianey de 21, los cuales ya estan casados, actualmente solo vive con su esposo. Ella nos platica que hace mas de 5 años ella y su familia siembran cafe y lo cosechan, ella su esposo y su hijo se encargan del cuidado de sus siembras de regarlo ponerle abonos y cuando llega el tiempo del cultivo del cafe le dan trabajo a algunas personas de la comunidad, despues de cosechar venden el cafe, nos platica que antes se lo vendian a un señor que tenia un molino pero hace un par de años cerro su molino y ahora lo venden en la comunidad y en algunas otras cercanas. ellos enden el cafe algunas veces en cereza(que es cuando esta maduro) y otras veces en Oro(grano). Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en abonos y fertilizantes para su siembra, tambien nos platico que espera en un futuro seguir trabajando ya que en estos tiempos la situacion economica esta muy dura y solo trabajando se puede salir adelante.(alguna de las personas que salen en la foto son amigos y vecinos que estaba ahi en ese momento y quisieron salir en la foto)



Los otros integrantes se llaman:
Senorina  - venta de antojitos
Camerina  - venta de ropa
Maria Lucrecia - venta de abarrotes
Eva  - venta de abarrotes
Yuridia - club nutricion 
Rosalia - venta de abarrotes
eulalia- venta zapatos
elodia-venta de catalago
dora maria -tienda ropa
genoveva- zapatos
texts.en:
In the State of Veracruz, in the town of Tezonapa, there is a community called El Cedro in which there is an 'UDE' (a group of more than ten people who have an account with the community bank and must meet up every one or two weeks to make their payments).  This group was named in honor of the community in which its members live.  It has eleven members.

The group's representative is called Emilia.  She is 52 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  Emilia is married and has three children (two daughters and one son): 24 year-old Graciela, 28 year-old Vicente and 21 year-old Vianey, who are all married.  Currently, Emilia only lives with her husband.  She tells us that she and her family have been growing and harvesting coffee for more than five years.  Emilia, her husband and her son look after the crops, watering them and applying fertilizers.  When the time comes to harvest the coffee, they provide work to some people in their community.  After harvesting, they sell the coffee.  Emilia tells us that they used to sell their coffee to a gentleman who owned a grinder but he closed down a couple of years ago and now they sell their produce within their own community and in some other nearby communities.  They sometimes sell coffee cherries (which is when the coffee is mature) and sometimes they sell the beans.

Emilia needs this loan to invest in fertilizers for her crops.  She tells us that she hopes to continue working in the future because the financial situation is very hard these days and you can only get ahead in life by working.

Some of the people who appear in this photo are friends and neighbors who were present when the photo was taken and wanted to appear in it.

The other members of the group are: 

Senorina - snack sales
Camerina - clothing sales
Maria Lucrecia - grocery sales
Eva - grocery sales
Yuridia - nutrition club
Rosalia - grocery sales
Eulalia - shoe sales
Elodia -  catalog sales
Dora maria - clothes store
Genoveva - shoe sales

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el local de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas y productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Bertha, age 31, has a life partner and one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  She works from 5:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her restaurant site.  She is requesting a loan to buy tables and products for cooking like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy tables and products for cooking like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa,maíz,cereal y trigo, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba en forma ambulatoria desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia tiene una tierra de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz, también en algunas oportunidades la socia lleva a vender a lugares como Calca y Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales como papa, maíz y trigo al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Guillermina, age 46, is a widow and has eight children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling potatoes, corn, grains, and wheat.  She sells in an itinerant manner at the Urubamba market.  She sells from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  

She has land where she grows potatoes and corn.  Sometimes she takes her products to sell in places like Calca and Cusco.

She wants to expand her business of selling grains.  She is requesting the loan to buy grains like potatoes, corn, and wheat wholesale.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy grains like potatoes, corn, and wheat wholesale.

loans.name: Katherin Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una madre joven de 21 años de edad, tiene un hijo con el que vive en casa de sus abuelos ubicada en el distrito de San José en Pacasmayo – La Libertad.

Gabriela se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, huevo, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc.), golosinas y bebidas en una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Su bodega cuenta con una gran demanda para la satisfacción de Gabriela.

Gabriela solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para invertir en el surtimiento de su negocio. Ella desea comprar nuevos productos y de marcas variadas para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.

Gabriela desea obtener mayores ganancias para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su pequeño hijo. Ella es muy conocida en su zona y es una persona de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young mother of 21 years of age. She has one son and she lives with him in his grandparents house in the district of San José in Pacasmayo-La Libertad.
Gabriela works selling groceries (rice, eggs, oil, sugar, noodles, etc), candies, and drinks, in a store that she runs in her home. To her satisfaction, there is a lot of demand for her store. 
Gabriela has requested a loan of $450 from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can supply her store. She wants to buy new products and more brands so she can keep her customers satisfied.
Gabriela wants to increase her income so that she can have a better quality of life for her and her little son. She is well know in her neighborhood and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to supply her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy watermelons, melons, oranges, avocados, mangos, cabbage, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loans.name: Mwanamimi

texts.en:
Mwanamimi is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past 14 years, Mwanamimi has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumption items retail and wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells coconut, her other source of income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Kazi Ni Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s is single with one child who is still going to school.  She has been running two businesses, selling bites and second hand clothes for 7 years now.  She works from 6.30am to 5.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the food she sells and started selling clothes.  She also started building her house and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is asking for a loan to buy and sell more clothes.  Her dream is to one day finish building her house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Kazi ni Kazi" which has 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy and sell more clothes.

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr: Valens  est client d’ACB depuis 2011,il est cultivateur de légumineuses, il est membre du groupe Abizeranye, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 8 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il a 33 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 7 et 2 an, 2 de ses enfants va  à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Valens va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de légumineuses et payer la main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique et la semence. Sa stratégie est d’étendre le terrain cultivé pour augmenter la production. Dans l’avenir, le profit va lui aider de construire une maison d’habitation de sa famille.
texts.en: Valens has been an ACB customer since 2011. He grows legumes (peas, beans etc) for a living, and is a member of the Abizeranye group. He was born in Rwanda, and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 33 years old and has four children between two and seven years old, two of whom attend school. This is the first loan that he has sought. Valens will use the loan to boost his legumes production and to pay for labour costs, chemical fertilisers and seeds. His aim is to extend his land so that he can boost production. In future, he would like to use the profits from his business in order to build a home for his family.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and to purchase seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: José Edgardo

texts.es:
José Edgardo tiene 33 años, es casado vive  con la esposa y con los hijos  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar tiene dos hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida.

Es una persona responsable y horada, le gusta jugar vóley, festejar carnaval.
texts.en:
José Edgardo is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The 'Patrón San Miguel' community bank is located in Pallaloma, 60 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The community bank has 13 members who work in agriculture, growing corn, potatoes and wheat.

José is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes and wheat.  He buys his products in Chillanes and San Pablo every month end and sells his products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

José is requesting this loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  José faces challenges in his business such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to provide his children with an education and to improve their quality of life.

José is a responsible and honest person who enjoys playing volleyball and celebrating Carnival.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Josselito Miguel

texts.es:
Josselito Miguel tiene 21 años, es soltero vive  con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar, no tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Josselito se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener sus propìas tierras para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta trabajar, hacer depoerte estar con su familia por son muy alegres.
texts.en:
Josselito Miguel is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. He has no children.

The members of the V.R.C. cooperative Patrón San Miguel can be found in the Pailaloma precinct, 60 minutes from the Chillanes canton office. This communal bank has 13 members who work in agriculture, cultivating corn, potatoes, and wheat.

Josselito works in agriculture. He plants corn and wheat. He buys products in Chillanes and in San Pablo at the end of every month and sells them at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

He is applying for the loan to purchase items needed for his crops, in addition to fertilizer and compost. The loan will help him economically to supply his needs and to increase production. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the variation in the climate. His dream is to have his own lands to continue planting.

He likes to work, do sports, and be with his family, because they are very happy.

loans.use: to buy items needed for his crops, in addition to fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Somoye

texts.en:
Somoe, a married woman with four children, owns the family home that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 10 years, Somoe has operated a bakery business, making and selling bread at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells palm leaves. Somoe faces the major challenge of seasonality, as during the rainy season she experiences low customer turnout.
