La  socia  Susana,  tiene 58 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 3 hijos, de 33, 29, 26 de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención personal de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia suele cada 4 meses comprar diversos productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite. y ahora ella desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes con la compra de productos de primera (leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite). 
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Susana, 58, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children who are 33, 29 and 26 years of age.  She alternates her daily chores with running and tending to her grocery store.  She wants to stock the store and be able to buy basic need items like: rice, sugar, noodles, milk and oil. 

She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan she’ll be granted which will allow her to improve her quality of life.  Similarly, she commits to repay her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil

loans.name: Ana Reyna

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Ana le esta haciendo falta el vitro piso en toda la casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleada de  un restaurante, ya que su esposo el señor Francisco se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como jefe de almacén de una tiene comercial. 
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan la comodidad y la seguridad cuando estén en casa.
texts.en:
Ana’s house lacks tile flooring throughout.  She is asking for a loan to buy the material because she lacks the necessary funds to carry out the improvement.

She plans to repay using the salary she earns as a restaurant employee since her husband, Francisco, will take charge of family expenses with income he earns as a warehouse supervisor at a department store.

They hope that their children will have comfort and security when they are at home.

loans.use: to install tile flooring in her house.

loans.name: Marcela Angela

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marcela, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 15, 13, 11,  6 y la menor que tiene 6 meses de nacida, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los dos que siguen están en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Es una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta productos Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y productos naturales de la marca Herbalive, trabaja todos los días todo el dia ya que vende en su casa, nos cuenta que solo sale los sabados que es el día que cobra. Dice que no deja su trabajo porque que le encanta vender y además por que con esto puede ayudar a su esposo en la difícil tarea de mantener un hogar, tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y productos naturales.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales.

En la foto la socia está con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez known for its beaches, its rich cuisine and for the warmth of its residents, the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meets every fifteen days.

We met Marcela, 33, here.  She’s married and has five children who are 15, 13, 11 and 6 years of age; the baby is 6 months old.  The two oldest are in high school and the next two are in elementary school.  Her husband’s a Driver.

She is a great housewife who, in order to earn her own income, sells Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories) and natural products of the Herbalife brand.  She works all day, every day, since she works from home.  She tells us that she only goes out on Saturdays which is the day she collects payment.  She says that she keeps working because she loves selling and besides she can help her husband with the difficult task of supporting a household.  She’s been in business for a year and does very well.

She will use the loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and natural products.  Her dream is that her children finish their schooling and become good professionals.

She appears in the photo with her little girl.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and natural products.

loans.name: Yina María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Yina, ella tiene 29 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 11, 8, 7 y 4 años, el mayor este año empezó el colegio, los dos siguientes están en escuela y el menor este año ingreso al jardín de infantes. Su marido es mecánico. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio hace cuatro ciclos y  le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a su esposo con el negocio en el cual ella también labora.

Tienen un taller de mecánica automotriz en el que realizan muchos trabajos, además también  venden repuestos, llantas, lubricantes, aceites y otras refacciones. Laboran de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 18h00, trabajan con la ayuda de dos operarios, mientras su esposo se encarga de los trabajos de mecánica ella se encarga de la contabilidad, compra y venta de los repuestos. Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio 9 años y que aunque al principio fue duro con el tiempo han conseguido muchos clientes que los prefieren por su trabajo y responsabilidad. Nos cuenta que muchas veces tienen que salir para hacer sus trabajos fuera de la ciudad.

Este crédito lo va en empleara en comprar aceite, repuestos, filtros, llantas, entre otros productos.
 
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the "Marianita de Jesús" communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Yina, 29, here.  She’s married and has four children who are 11, 8, 7 and 4 years of age.  The oldest started secondary school this year, the next two are in elementary school and the youngest started Kindergarten this year.  Her husband is a Mechanic.  She’s been in the communal bank since four cycles ago and she likes it because with the loans she’s been able to help her husband with his business where she now works too.

They have an auto repair shop where they do all kinds of jobs.  They also sell spare parts: tires, lubricants, oil and other parts.  They work Monday through Saturday from 7:30am until 6pm; they have two employees.  While her husband does the mechanical work she handles the bookkeeping, purchasing and spare parts sales.  She tells us that they’ve been in business 9 years and, although it was difficult at first, they’ve managed to secure many customers who prefer them for their work and responsibility.  She tells us that often they have jobs to do outside the city.

She will use this loan to buy oil, spare parts, filters and tires, among other products.  Her goal is to enlarge the business.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, spare parts, filters, tires, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de graduación de sus hijos. 
Doña Antonia tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes este es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para darle lo mejor a su familia. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que desea que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesario para que tengan un futuro mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
Antonia is asking for a loan to pay for her children’s graduation expenses.

She has a grocery store that’s the family’s source of income and what she has to provide the best for her family.

She will use part of her profits from her business to repay the loan because she wants her children to have the necessary schooling so that they will have a better future in life.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia Elena

texts.es:
Cecilia vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene un restaurante donde vende permanentemente los más deliciosos menús típicos, como sancochos, asados de pollo y carne a la plancha principalmente; ella inició su negocio para adicionarle a su hogar un segundo ingreso que aumentara el bienestar de su familia, compuesta por su conyugue y su hijo de 9 años. 
Hoy Cecilia goza de una buena clientela y para lograr perfeccionar su oficio, está estudiando cocina internacional con la que impactará el mercado próximamente, pues son pocos los negocios que ofrecen este tipo de comidas, su sueño es hacerlo crecer y con el aprendizaje de nuevos platos, diversificará su oferta y agregará a ella comidas típica sabanera, muy apetecidas en la ciudad. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, referidos y algunos empleados. 
Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, con tal de ahorrar en sus compras con los descuentos que ofrecen los proveedores y también comprará silletería plásticas, para aumentar las posibilidades de acceso a nuevos clientes, que muchas veces se van, porque todas las sillas están ocupadas. Su sueño es ubicar su infraestructura en un punto estratégico de mayor alcance, para lograr ser reconocida visualmente desde el principio y no a través de referidos como es lo que hasta ahora está ayudandole al incremento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in the city of Barranquilla and has a restaurant where she permanently sells the most delicious traditional meals like “sancocho,” (a hardy soup), grilled chicken and meat.  She started her business to add a second income to her home to increase the wellbeing of her family which consists of her husband and 9-year-old son.

Today, Cecilia enjoys a good clientele and to perfect her occupation is studying international cuisine to impact the market soon since there are few businesses that offer this type of meal.  Her dream is to make it grow and by learning new dishes she’ll diversify her offering and add meals typical of the savannah which are very appreciated in the city.  Her main customers are neighbors, referred folks and a few employees.

This is the first loan Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has granted her and she’ll use it to buy raw materials in large volume to save on costs taking advantage of discounts offered by suppliers for bulk purchases.  She will also buy plastic tables and chairs to increase access possibilities for new customers who often leave because all the seats are occupied.

Her dream is to install her infrastructure in a strategic spot with wider reach to become visually recognized from the beginning and not through referrals which is what’s been helping her sales grow to date.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk to take advantage of discounts offered by suppliers and also to buy plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Dayci Araceli

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio.  Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella además de realizar las labores de su hogar también se dedica al comercio y realiza los quehaceres domésticos de otras casas. Comparte su tiempo entre sus trabajos y sus ventas ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a una casa a realizar los quehaceres domésticos y también realiza la limpieza de un departamento que tiene a su cargo. Después de realizar estas labores ella se desplaza puerta a puerta ofreciendo sus productos, vende zapatillas y productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Sus productos los deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva un año vendiendo los productos Yanbal mientras que lo que es zapatillas recién lleva seis meses.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y zapatillas. Está en el  Banco Comunal hace dos  ciclos, es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta porque se lleva bien con sus compañeras y ha hecho más amigas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the "Marianita de Jesús" communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Daysi, 34, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 15 and 13 years of age; they both are in middle school.  Her husband is a Fisherman.

Besides doing her household chores, she also is a merchant and does domestic work in other houses.  She shares her time among her jobs and her sales because in the morning she has to go to a house to do domestic chores and she also cleans an apartment that’s in her care.  After doing these chores she goes door to door offering her products.  She sells sandals and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories.)  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She tells us that she’s been selling Yanbal for a year but has only been selling the sandals for six months.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry and sandals.  She’s been in the communal bank since two cycles ago.  She is the Payments Supervisor in the bank and likes it because she gets along well with her fellow members and she’s made new friends.  Her dream is to continue working and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry and sandals.

loans.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es:
Luis tiene 21 años de edad, él es soltero, cuenta con  casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Luis se gana la vida desde hace 2 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.
Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de labores en agricultura.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de animales para su comercialización ymejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

luis es una persona responsable y puntual, además cuenta con muy buenas referncias.
texts.en:
Luis tiene 21 años de edad, él es soltero, cuenta con  casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Luis se gana la vida desde hace 2 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.
Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de labores en agricultura.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de animales para su comercialización ymejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

luis es una persona responsable y puntual, además cuenta con muy buenas referncias.

loans.use: Compra de animales con sus respectivos alimentos y mejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room at the front of his house.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Estrella tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía como es zapatos, ropa para niños, juguetes y ropa de temporada de verano. Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de la mercancía serán para pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Eleuterio le ayudara con los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos. 
Desea tener mas más mercancía para vender, para en un futuro tener un local fijo, ya que por el momento esta vendiendo la mercancía afuera de su casa.
texts.en:
For more than five years, Estrella has worked selling new and used clothing. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise such as shoes, children's clothing, toys, and clothes for the summer season. With the earnings she obtains from selling the merchandise, she will pay off the loan, since her husband, Eleuterio, will help her with the family's expenses and the school costs for their three children. 
 
She would like to have more merchandise to sell, and in the future she would like to have a permanent store, since for the time being she is selling her merchandise outside her house.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her clothing sales business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ofelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods and home cleaning supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ofelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods and home cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en: Soeng is a local farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To make a living, she and her husband grow two rice crops a year, one during the rainy season and one during the dry season.  They earn an average of $5 a day. Soeng will use her loan to buy a plot of fertile land from her neighbor in order to enlarge her rice crop planting.  She can also rent the land to other villagers for a fee. Soeng is blessed with four children, three of whom are single and one is married.

loans.use: buy a plot of land

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, age 55, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Mom is a housewife. Her husband is a veterinarian, earning an income of $5.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her children who are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. 

Their standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for one of her children’s wedding. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for one of her children's wedding.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine  is from the village of Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married. 

To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, age 30, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sareoun is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Their standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $400 to finish her construction of her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath, age 37, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sambath is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a mechanic, earning an income of $10 per day. 

The standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for her children’s administration fee to work in South Korea. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the children's administration fee to work in South Korea.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 28, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Phalla is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a driver, earning an income of $5 per day. 

The standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $800 to finish the construction of her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is Vat, age 47.  He lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. He is a building worker in and around his village. From his job, he typically makes around $1.75 income each day to manage his family's daily expenses. To help better meet the family's demands, his wife makes Khmer cakes to sell and earns approximately $1.25 a day.  This couple resides with their three children, two of whom are students and one has married and lives separately. 

Vat has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to purchase more ingredients to make Khmer cake for sale and to buy zinc to cover the roof of his house that has cracked.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make cakes to sell and to repair house roof

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor is 54 and resides in Prey Veng province, one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia.  Nhor is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 25 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. Nhor is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish the construction on her house

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with 4 children. Regina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Regina is a farmer and plants and harvest rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. 
Regina has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mory

texts.en:
Mory, 50, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. 

Mory is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of US $2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $25 on food and US $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Mory is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish construction of her house.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn  is from the village of Katipa, Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old. Merilyn is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Merilyn owns and operates a general store. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Merilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as can goods, dry goods, and home chores need

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tey

texts.en:
Ty, 47, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Ty is a housewife and a farmer during rainy season while her husband is employed at a construction company, earning an income of USD 2 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Ty is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields.

loans.name: Januka

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Januka. She is married and has one child, aged 16.  

In 2005, she established  her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she suports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Januka plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD .50. 

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and it can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy a young milking cow.

loans.name: Enerio

texts.en:
Enerio is from the village of Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 33 years old. Enerio is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Enerio owns and operates a rice retail store in the local community. Enerio has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Enerio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Enerio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,200 PHP from PMPC. 

Enerio is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice retail store. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Enerio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice retail store.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a retail business since the beginning of 2008.  From the front of her house, she sells different kinds of merchandise to her neighbors and passing travelers.  She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, costume jewelry, cooking ingredients, fast food, plastic products, soft drinks, and other miscellaneous products.  Her husband is a chicken breeder. They have one child who works as a car repairer in a local garage. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Heng will be using the loan she requested to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Durga. She is married and has one child, aged 9.  

In 2001, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Durga plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Niru

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Niru. She is married and has three children ages 23,  21 and 17.  

In 2001, she established  her cow raising business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Niru plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD .50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Oprecida

texts.en:
Oprecida is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old. Oprecida is single. 

To make a living, Oprecida owns and operates a general store. Oprecida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Oprecida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Oprecida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Oprecida is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and house chore needs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Oprecida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and house chore needs.

location.town: San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Sangita.  She is married and has three children (24, 20 and 17).  In 2003, she established her poultry farming business. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Sangita works seven days a week and five hours a day to support her family.  She has successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and her most recent loan was used to buy small chickens.  In the future, Sangita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok is a 42-year-old married man who works in a rubber plant in the province of Siem Reap. From this, he earns an income of around $4.25 each day to use for the family's daily expenses. To earn more income, Mr. Sok’s wife has been planting a few fruit trees on their land. They are blessed with two children who are studying in the local school and depend on their income for support. The rainy season is approaching, so Mr. Sok has requested  a loan to plant potatoes.

loans.use: plant potatoes

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en: Mr. Amarsanaa is 34 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in Kherlen city of Dornod Aimag, the far eastern province of Mongolia which is 750 km away from the capital city. They live in rented apartment at the moment and they have a dream to have their own family house. Amarsanaa’s 2 children attend a secondary school. Amarsanaa has been working for 6 years as a baker in his sister’s bakery. His wife runs a taxi business using her family car. Amarsanaa always dreamed of having his own pig farm so he decided to start a pig farming business. He has already made some financial projections and market research. The loan Amarsanaa is taking will be used to buy a couple of piglets and start fulfilling his dream to have a pig farming business.

loans.use: to buy a couple of piglets and start fulfilling his dream to have a pig farming business

loans.name: Abibatu Z

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Abibatu. She is married, and has 6 children ages 28, 24, 20, 16, 13 and 6 years old. She has one additional dependent, her niece, who lives with her. 

In 2004, Abibatu established her drugstore business. She began her business after training and becoming a qualified nurse. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy additional essential drugs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Abibatu plans to educate her children to any level of education they wish to attain. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for essential drugs for her business

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is 50 years old and married. She has 3 children ages 24, 20 and 16. Her husband works as a farmer.

Eustaquia has a food-vending business. She makes rice cakes, banana and camote cue, and other delicacies. She goes around her community to sell what she makes. Eustaquia also buys and resells vegetables.

Eustaquia requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and bananas. She also plans to use part of her loan to buy fertilizers for the farm her husband tills. Eustaquia plans to renovate their house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and bananas

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Michael. He is married and has three children, aged 11, 7 and 4 years. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they are his late brother’s children.  

In 2009, Michael established his rice business. He began his business because he needed a reliable means of getting income to support his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 900,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Michael requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Michael plans to extend his business and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional local foodstuffs.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Dioscora is a married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

Dioscora is engaged in farming and the hog-raising business. She helps her husband grow rice at their farm. She raises her pigs in her backyard piggery. Dioscora works hard to provide for her family. She said she wants her children to be able to eat three times a day.

Dioscora has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase piglets, feeds and fertilizers. She hopes for a stable business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two sons, aged 6 and 9. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons attend a local primary school. Davaasuren is a professional tailor. Davaasuren supports her family by operating her handmade kid’s shoes business with help from her husband. She sews kid’s shoes to sell them at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2004, she sold her handmade shoes at a cheap price. Now her skill is high and her handmade shoes are quality and daedal (finely and skillfully made), so demand for her handmade shoes is high in Narantuul. She purchases her materials from Narantuul. Davaasuren is requesting a loan of 700,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoe materials to make shoes before the Mongolian national celebration, called “Naadam,” because demand for this shoe rises during this celebration. Davaasuren wants to improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe materials to make kid's shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional bales of used clothing

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 35, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Nary sells groceries and is a cleaner for a private company, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 83 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Nary is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a stand at the market to start a new business by selling groceries. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a stand at the market to sell groceries

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is from the town of Lopez Jaena, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Emely is married and has 3 adult-age children. To make a living, Emely owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. Emely is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products such as can goods, dry goods, and home products. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Emely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as can goods, dry goods, and home products

loans.name: Dianalina

texts.en:
Dianalina is 26 years old and married. She has a 3-year-old child. Her husband is a fisherman.

Dianalina is a seaweed farmer. She cultivates seaweed and sells it to buyers at her town. She also sells her husband’s catch at her town’s market. Dianalina needs materials for seaweed farming such as, straw and bamboo sticks. She has requested a loan so she can continue her business. Dianalina hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for seaweed farming such as  straw and bamboo sticks

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art, 37, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Art is a housewife while her husband is employed to break stones into pieces to sell, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 123 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Art is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve her family farming. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith, 45, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in the country. Ith is a housewife, while two of her children are employed at a factory, earning an income of $2 US each per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $25 on other necessary expenses. 

Ith is requesting a loan of $1000 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish her construction of her house

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 16 years old. 

Erna has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. She plans to user her loan to buy pig feed and vitamins. Each month, Erna earns 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her hog-raising business. 

In the future, Erna hopes to have a stable business that would help her sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Big

texts.en:
Big, 58, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions the country. 

Big is a housewife while her three children are employed at the factory, earning an income of $2 US each per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Big is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fabrics to resell. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to resell

loans.name: Batzorig

texts.en:
Batzorig is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batzorig’s mother is unemployed and looks after the household, and his father works in local council as a water distributor, distributing fresh water to slum district households. 

Batzorig runs a taxi business using his family's car. To run a taxi business without a warm garage is impossible, especially in the winter, because during winter nights cars freeze and people always have trouble starting them. 

Last year Batzorig started building a warm garage for his car and at the moment the basement is completed. The loan Batzorig is taking out will be used to complete the garage building project with the purchase of bricks, cement, and a garage door.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and a garage door and finish an uncompleted garage

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong, 33, is a resident of Siem Reap Province. He is a domestic farmer and earns an average of $4 a day. He is married to Mrs. Saroun, 30, who is also a farmer.  They have three school-aged children. Mr. Kong used to raise pigs in the past but had to stop that activity due to financial problems faced by his family. He now hopes to return to this business by using a Kiva loan to buy pig feed and piglets for breeding. This will provide him with additional income which he will use to better meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, is 51 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a general store in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Adelaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more products such as canned goods, dry goods, and home needs, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned goods, dry goods, and home  needs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 35 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture selling agricultural equipment in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more equipment for her enterprise, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her farm supplies business.

location.town: Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Pea

texts.en: Mrs. Pea, 46, is married to Nem Loy, 56, who catches fresh fish in and around the lakes of his community. Mrs. Pea sells the  fresh fish that her husband and other fishermen catch for reasonable prices. Presently, she also sells some merchandise around her village for extra income. Because of her old broken motorbike, her fish selling business has been affected.  In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Pea is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a married woman with two children. She is 57 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years.

Marciana sells items like sugar, spices and detergent soap to the people in her community. She earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her store. Marciana also provides tailoring services.

Marciana is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soap.

In the future, Marciana hopes to have a productive business and successful children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soap.

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en: Tumenjargal, 43, is married and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have daughter who is married. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Tumenjargal graduated from a course with a concentration in tailoring in 1999. Since 2000, she had been sewing the traditional Mongolian robes called deel. Her husband is a herdsman. Tumenjargal supports her family by operating her handmade clothing business. She usually sews deels to sell them in Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She purchases her materials for handmade clothing from Narantuul. Tumenjargal is requesting a loan of 700,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more deel materials to sew deels before the Mongolian national celebration, called Naadam, because the demand for deel rises during this celebration. Tumenjargal wants to improve her business with this loan and then be able to build her own small house.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to sew Mongolian traditional robes.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda  is from the village of San Roque, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old. Merlinda is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merlinda makes and sells food. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

The setting on the digital camera had the incorrect date, so the photo appears to have been taken earlier than it actually was taken.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
